text:
Cap fitment/printing update:
* Not all the caps printed fit all the bottles (5 wines, 10 bottles, without a proper fitting cap)
* Original Cap inner diameter is 30 mm
* Miguel printed alternate caps with IDs 31, 32, and 33
* ~0.5mm ID shrinkage noticed on all caps (33 = 32.5 IRL)
* 33mm caps were too fragile and broke, not suitable for demo, need alternative (2 wines affected)
* Miguel printing 4x 32mm and 6x 31mm (to cover 3 wines)
* Miguel is also printing 25 additional of the original 30mm ID caps
* Spreadsheet with bottle IDs and fitment: <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZR_GInu4VD2y_ls0qYLJkpAgAdFoJ5DDEzby242iTGw/edit?usp=sharing>
*Miguel is awesome for donating his spare time to print all these
<@U0K8ZSHN0|lee> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/lee/F11C8SWFJ/sommelydiameters-sheet1|Sommely Cap Housing Diameters>
Also, I will pick up boards on tuesday
I would strongly suggest just getting different wine. Screw tops seem to work well
That's possible if we also have pictures to go with it
Oh we would have to retake pictures? I guess that's a counterargument
another alternative is to just use wine bottle where caps fit
Or we buy additional bottles that we already have, e.g., a second instance of a bottle that fits

It'd be within the realm of possibility that someone would have a couple of a certain type of wine. I'll take a look at what fits this week and can pick up some extras (hopefully I can source at new seasons or wholefoods
